info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 7 at 10:08AM CDT by NWS Dodge City KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kansas...
Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County.
For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by prior rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Crooked Creek near Englewood.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Prepare for minor overflows along portions of crooked creek in southern Meade county as the creek moves out onto the floodplain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 3.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.5 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
Next statement is likely by Sunday morning at 1000 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
